data.content:
I'm not really sure why so many people are leaving negative reviews. "Loading screen is long" at least you can play. "Crashes" your phone must be broken a lot. I'm on a 5, and the graphics are amazing, works fine, good enough range of Pokémon for MY area (not a lot 😂), and loads of fun! If the game crashes, then something's wrong with YOU. What my phone does: 

Open app
Immediately crashes
Open again
Loads 20 seconds 
Get blue screen with white outlines
Restart game
Fine.

If you really want to play, you'd be willing to do that. You're meant to to it walking. No pokestops? Go for a drive. They refresh every 5 minutes. GET USED TO IT. 
This game is PERFECT considering that a massive update has just come out, of course there'll be some bugs. Keep it up Niantic!!

data.content: Im looking at these 1 star reviews and I'm dying a little bit on the inside. What?!. This app is a dream come true! Sure it's had a few MINOR issues, but what app doesn't? Let's review the game itself. I can find bulbasaur in my garden, staryu on the beach, I might find a ghastly in the dark of night. I can hatch eggs by walking! WALKING! How many games make you want to get up and do some exercise? Not many. And this is absolutely brilliant for sightseeing. I was in Whitby the other weekend and I walked past a boulder in the road many times without a second thought, it wasn't until I decided to catch a few pokes till I discovered that this boulder was once used as a step to mount horses (thank you Pokémon go). I haven't known a world without Pokemon and this app brings them even closer in the most brilliant way. Even if you're not a pokegeek like me I recommend giving this app a whirl.
data.title: BEST GAME EVER!

data.content:
Pre gen 2 release the game was virtually bug free for me.. now the update has come there's too many things wrong. Firstly the gen 2 Pokemon were only on high spawn for around 24 hours, now I'm back to pidgeys and zubats non stop on my finder. The GPS location is almost always inaccurate with my avatar "going too fast" despite me being standstill. The glitch of KM roundup is still bad (where your km walked is not accurately tracked and jumps from say 0 - 3 in one go, not progressive.) Constantly slow when loading or even trying to load a Pokemon, half the time you select the Pokemon to catch and it says there's an 'Error' and the Pokemon disappears. This is more annoying when you re open the app and that same Pokemon is still available but you can't select it. 
I love this game but please do a bug fix soon or you'll end up losing players again as the bugs for gen 2 put people off.
data.title: Great Game but constant bug fixes needed

data.content:
Gave me cancer! After all the poor updates and lack of community awareness I come back to see if any things changed and nope, the app is still getting worse. Simply adding some overdue gen2 and the app won't stay open longer than 10 seconds now. Developers are on crack with all the money their cancer patients have been tricked into giving them. 

FINALLY a watch app.... but we can't catch Pokèmon like advertised at the original announcement!! Wow, Niantic are great at finding ways to disappoint everyone, false advertising at its finest. 
If they're still fixing 'minor text' issues this late into development I think they should hand this over to a responsible dev team. 

No effort being put into this game at all, still no watch app. 
Worst developer ever, takes months to add simple features like multiple candy selection or km count but still can't fix the audio issue or implement a tracking system that is actually usable. ALSO NO APPLE WATCH APP YET!!!! Despite Niantic making the announcement on the biggest stage they could find, absolute money grabbers. 

New edit: 
Too little, too late! Pretty poor nearby system, gyms are still useless and no development of the game has happened at all. No Apple Watch app either which is half the reason I bought one, thanks Niantic, the least community based company ever. If you can't develop a decent app or understand your actual audience give this to somebody else. Screw Niantic for ruining my favourite franchise and being money grabbing trolls. 

HALLOWEEN UPDATE WHY!
So this months useless update has not only not added any useful features, it's made the app worse. Battery saver renders my screen useless and remains black and having the app open makes my audio like Spotify and SoundCloud too quiet too hear, even though I have all audio off in the game :( if I'm doing my usual 10km commutes I 100% choose music and podcasts over the cancer that is Pokémon go. 

No updates are better than these useless 'updates'. If it's taken this long to simply change egg colours I doubt we'll see any useful updates in our lifetimes. 
Ruined a lot of people's childhoods and the massive potential of the IP. 

Sell outs who've spent all this time taking Apples money instead of fixing the one thing that made this game playable (nearby/sightings).  
So much potential with one of the biggest fan followings to date and it's all being destroyed by poor/non existent communication and foolish choices in updates. 
They don't deserve the audience they've gathered.
data.title: Always getting worse - Money Grabbers

data.content:
iPhone Review: 4/5

Pokémon GO is a great concept. You encounter familiar characters in the open world and it even gives us an incentive to go out and get some exercise. As a game, it's done far more than any other mobile game has done; it's helped us become more social, I've seen more people join up and play the game together than ever.

As someone who has played the original handheld games from Nintendo, I've found it to be a pleasant change. The new mechanics are easy to learn, and the gameplay stays largely faithful to the original material. It's something that both newcomers to the franchise and veteran players can enjoy. Barring from the very occasional login glitch, it's been a great experience as a whole.

So why the 2-star rating then? Well, there's the other side of the story.

---

Apple Watch Review: 0/5

The experience on the Apple Watch is completely different, for the worse. For one, the game is the most unstable app I have ever had the displeasure to test. I open the app, start a play session, then check the device again after a while to find that ten times out of ten the app has crashed back to the watch screen, erasing all play progress up to that point. I have never finished a single play session that did not involve force-crashing and loss of data. And that's when the app can be launched properly in the first place.

Usually when opening the app on Apple Watch one of three things can happen - either the app stays on the loading screen perpetually until the watch auto-sleeps (whereby it crashes back to the Home Screen upon wake), the app launches but fails to sync my data and displays a blank profile, or very occasionally it launches normally and loads my profile only to crash mid-gameplay. Crashing on the Apple Watch will also carry over to the iPhone, if I have the game running on both devices and it crashes on my watch, the process will also be forcilby terminated on the iPhone and any progress will be lost.

This issue can be replicated on a newly restored Apple Watch running on stock settings, and appears to be due to coding issues and not because of system resource limitations. It's very clear that Pokémon GO for the Apple Watch was rushed in development to make it in time for the iPhone 7 launch keynote appearance, and rushed once again for release in the 2016 holiday season. Without proper stability testing, the users are now paying the price for a rushed product.

---

Overall Rating: 2/5

Pokémon GO is a great idea to begin with. It helps us be more active, more social, and is generally a very enjoyable game in itself. Sadly, this is hampered by serious performance and stability issues that ruin the gameplay and interrupt the positive experience with frustration. If you want a social game that can be enjoyed by everyone, both novice and experienced in Pokémon, then look no further. However if you want to play on the go with the Apple Watch, give this a miss - it's not worth the frustration.

---

Tested on:
iPhone 7 (iOS 10.2.1)
Apple Watch (WatchOS 3.1.3)

data.content:
Pokémon GO is an amazing app that has taken me out to lots of new places, and I would recommend it. It, like anything else, has flaws, but you have to remember that it is still in its beta stages; the main game isn't finished yet. Plus, most of the bugs that were in the original release have been fixed or eradicated -- I haven't had the game crash since its launch month!

All of the updates are amazing. We should be glad that Niantic continue updating this game, people! 😀

data.content:
This game was great at first, at least until it wouldn't stop crashing. Even with the new update, it still crashes, leaving me unable to play the game. This may be because I cannot get iOS 10 because my phone is incompatible with it. I hope that the glitches will stop but I am not too sure because the updates are not working. 
When I got a new phone, it worked great. The graphics were faster and it did not crash. 
There is also some new features like the buddy feature that I like and I have found with the gen 2 release, which is pretty nice on its own, there has been some new clothing features. This is nice, but there is not much choice unless you want to blow out at least 100 Pokècoins to look good. This is not aplicible to all people, because some are fine with the things they have on. 
There is still some issues with the game, e.g. Pokèstops not working or the "You're going too fast" pop up when you are walking or even sat on a bench in the park, which I think should be fixed. 
Overall this game is great, unless you don't have iOS 10 or above, then the game freezes a lot and is a great disappointment.
data.title: Pretty good, but...

data.content:
This game was great when it came out; revolutionary even, and it still is. But I notice a lot of people saying that there are loads of bugs and that it is a crappy game because of that, and also that Niantic don't care about how good their customers' experiences of their games are as long as they make money. Well, come on people, it's a free game!!! What annoys me is the fact that so many people just look at the negatives of the app; look at all the positives and your mind will be changed easily!

For example:

Sometimes the game crashes or things don't load- that is probably because your phone is a too old model or you don't have the most recent iOS update!
Also sometimes when you get to higher levels you can't catch Pokémon as easily- why do you need the common Pokémon if you already have the final evolution and you are obviously already a high level?

There are loads of positives, like:
Have you ever seen a game where you explore the real world catching fantasy monsters that everyone loves? Have you ever explored the world and collected Pokéballs from famous landmarks before? It seems stupid, but it's revolutionary! The tracking; think about how long this game took to code! I bet most of you people saying that this is a bad game would never even be able to code the Pokémon making sounds when you tap them!

Anyway, I have one point, and one point only... think about the effort put into this game, and then you'll see why Niantic DO care about their customers.
Oh, and I almost forgot to mention... IT's FREE!!!!!
data.title: IT'S FREE!!!
